intro: Senecio uncinellus, commonly known as the hooked senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Senecio uncinellus is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
